datasource.description: Enable to include datasource information for each linked object.

count.description: Maximum number of entries to return.

skip_to.description: Skip to Nth CMDB entry. Only collect statistical data after it.

with_meta.description: Enable to include meta information about each object (type id, references, etc).

with_contents_hash.description: Enable to include a checksum of each object's contents.

skip.description: Enable to call CLI skip operator to hide skipped properties.

format.description: List of property names to include in results, separated by | (i.e. policyid|srcintf).

filter.description:
Filtering multiple key/value pairs
Operator     |   Description
==     |   Case insensitive match with pattern.
!=     |    Does not match with pattern (case insensitive).
=@     |    Pattern found in object value (case insensitive).
!@     |    ﻿Pattern not﻿ found in object value (case insensitive).
<=     |    Value must be less than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
<     |    Value must be less than pattern﻿.
.>=    |    Value must be greater than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
.>     |    Value must be greater than ﻿pattern﻿.
Logical OR    |    Separate filters using commas ','
Logical AND    |    Filter strings can be combined to create logical AND queries by including multiple filters in the request.
Combining AND and OR    |    You can combine AND and OR filters together to create more complex filters.

key.description: If present, objects will be filtered on property with this name.

pattern.description: If present, objects will be filtered on property with this value.

datasource_format.description: A map of datasources to a string of attributes, separated by | (ie: policyid|srcintf). If specified, this will add the attributes listed for any linked objects.

unfiltered_count.description: Maximum number of unfiltered entries to interate through.

stat-items.description: Items to count occurrence in entire response (multiple items should be separated by '|').

primary_keys.description: The primary key to find indexes for.

action.description:
default: Return the CLI default values for entire CLI tree.
meta: Return meta data for a specific object, table, or the entire CLI tree.
json-schema: Return JSON Schema for entire CLI tree.
schema: Return schema for entire CLI tree.

vdom.description:
Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

action.description:
If supported, an action can be specified.
_move_: Move this specific resource.
When *action=move* is set, one of the extra parameters (*before*, *after*) must be provided.
__*Note:*__ If this parameter is provided when not supported, the action will be ignored and an “invalid request” error will be returned.

before.description:
If *action=move*, use *before* to specify the ID of the resource that this resource will be moved before.
For example, to move `object 1` to before `object 2`, use:
__action=move&before=2__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *move*.

after.description:
If *action=move*, use *after* to specify the ID of the resource that this resource will be moved after.
For example, to move `object 1` to after `object 3`, use:
__action=move&after=3__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *move*.

scope.description:
Specify the Scope from which results are returned or changes are applied to. Objects are only existed in global scope.
scope=global

GET.summary:
Select all entries in a CLI table.
 Access Group: sysgrp

PUT.summary:
Update this specific resource.
 Access Group: sysgrp

fortiguard-anycast.name: fortiguard-anycast
fortiguard-anycast.help: Enable/disable use of FortiGuard's Anycast network.

options.help: Enable use of FortiGuard's Anycast network.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Enable use of FortiGuard's Anycast network

options.name: disable

options.label: Disable
options.description: Disable use of FortiGuard's Anycast network

fortiguard-anycast-source.help: Configure which of Fortinet's servers to provide FortiGuard services in FortiGuard's anycast network. Default is Fortinet.

options.help: Use Fortinet's servers to provide FortiGuard services in FortiGuard's anycast network.
options.label: Fortinet
options.description: Use Fortinet's servers to provide FortiGuard services in FortiGuard's anycast network

options.name: aws

options.name: debug

options.name: udp
options.help: UDP for server communication (for use by FortiGuard or FortiManager).
options.label: Udp
options.description: UDP for server communication (for use by FortiGuard or FortiManager)

options.name: http
options.help: HTTP for server communication (for use only by FortiManager).
options.label: Http

options.name: https
options.help: HTTPS for server communication (for use by FortiGuard or FortiManager).
options.label: Https
options.description: HTTPS for server communication (for use by FortiGuard or FortiManager)

port.name: port
port.help: Port used to communicate with the FortiGuard servers.

load-balance-servers.name: load-balance-servers
load-balance-servers.help: Number of servers to alternate between as first FortiGuard option.

auto-join-forticloud.name: auto-join-forticloud
auto-join-forticloud.help: Automatically connect to and login to FortiCloud.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable automatic connection and login to FortiCloud.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Enable automatic connection and login to FortiCloud

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable automatic connection and login to FortiCloud.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Disable automatic connection and login to FortiCloud

update-server-location.name: update-server-location
update-server-location.help: Location from which to receive FortiGuard updates.

options.name: automatic
options.help: FortiGuard servers chosen based on closest proximity to FortiGate unit.
options.label: Automatic
options.description: FortiGuard servers chosen based on closest proximity to FortiGate unit

options.name: eu
options.help: FortiGuard servers in the European Union.
options.label: Eu
options.description: FortiGuard servers in the European Union

persistent-connection.name: persistent-connection
persistent-connection.help: Enable/disable use of persistent connection to receive update notification from FortiGuard.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable persistent connection to receive update notification from FortiGuard.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Enable persistent connection to receive update notification from FortiGuard

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable persistent connection to receive update notification from FortiGuard.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Disable persistent connection to receive update notification from FortiGuard

auto-firmware-upgrade.name: auto-firmware-upgrade
auto-firmware-upgrade.help: Enable/disable automatic patch-level firmware upgrade from FortiGuard. The FortiGate unit searches for new patches only in the same major and minor version.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable automatic patch-level firmware upgrade to latest version from FortiGuard.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Enable automatic patch-level firmware upgrade to latest version from FortiGuard

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable automatic patch-level firmware upgrade to latest version from FortiGuard.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Disable automatic patch-level firmware upgrade to latest version from FortiGuard

auto-firmware-upgrade-day.name: auto-firmware-upgrade-day
auto-firmware-upgrade-day.help: Allowed day(s) of the week to install an automatic patch-level firmware upgrade from FortiGuard (default is none). Disallow any day of the week to use auto-firmware-upgrade-delay instead, which waits for designated days before installing an automatic patch-level firmware upgrade.

auto-firmware-upgrade-delay.name: auto-firmware-upgrade-delay
auto-firmware-upgrade-delay.help: Delay of day(s) before installing an automatic patch-level firmware upgrade from FortiGuard (default = 3). Set it 0 to use auto-firmware-upgrade-day instead, which selects allowed day(s) of the week for installing an automatic patch-level firmware upgrade.

auto-firmware-upgrade-start-hour.name: auto-firmware-upgrade-start-hour
auto-firmware-upgrade-start-hour.help: Start time in the designated time window for automatic patch-level firmware upgrade from FortiGuard in 24 hour time (0 ~ 23, default = 2). The actual upgrade time is selected randomly within the time window.

auto-firmware-upgrade-end-hour.name: auto-firmware-upgrade-end-hour
auto-firmware-upgrade-end-hour.help: End time in the designated time window for automatic patch-level firmware upgrade from FortiGuard in 24 hour time (0 ~ 23, default = 4). When the end time is smaller than the start time, the end time is interpreted as the next day. The actual upgrade time is selected randomly within the time window.

FDS-license-expiring-days.name: FDS-license-expiring-days
FDS-license-expiring-days.help: Threshold for number of days before FortiGuard license expiration to generate license expiring event log (1 - 100 days, default = 15).

subscribe-update-notification.name: subscribe-update-notification
subscribe-update-notification.help: Enable/disable subscription to receive update notification from FortiGuard.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable subscription to receive update notification from FortiGuard.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Enable subscription to receive update notification from FortiGuard

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable subscription to receive update notification from FortiGuard.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Disable subscription to receive update notification from FortiGuard

antispam-force-off.name: antispam-force-off
antispam-force-off.help: Enable/disable turning off the FortiGuard antispam service.

options.name: enable
options.help: Turn off the FortiGuard antispam service.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Turn off the FortiGuard antispam service

antispam-cache.name: antispam-cache
antispam-cache.help: Enable/disable FortiGuard antispam request caching. Uses a small amount of memory but improves performance.

antispam-cache-ttl.name: antispam-cache-ttl
antispam-cache-ttl.help: Time-to-live for antispam cache entries in seconds (300 - 86400). Lower times reduce the cache size. Higher times may improve performance since the cache will have more entries.

antispam-cache-mpermille.name: antispam-cache-mpermille
antispam-cache-mpermille.help: Maximum permille of FortiGate memory the antispam cache is allowed to use (1 - 150).

antispam-license.name: antispam-license
antispam-license.help: Interval of time between license checks for the FortiGuard antispam contract.

antispam-expiration.name: antispam-expiration
antispam-expiration.help: Expiration date of the FortiGuard antispam contract.

antispam-timeout.name: antispam-timeout
antispam-timeout.help: Antispam query time out (1 - 30 sec, default = 7).

outbreak-prevention-force-off.name: outbreak-prevention-force-off
outbreak-prevention-force-off.help: Turn off FortiGuard Virus Outbreak Prevention service.

outbreak-prevention-cache.name: outbreak-prevention-cache
outbreak-prevention-cache.help: Enable/disable FortiGuard Virus Outbreak Prevention cache.

outbreak-prevention-cache-ttl.name: outbreak-prevention-cache-ttl
outbreak-prevention-cache-ttl.help: Time-to-live for FortiGuard Virus Outbreak Prevention cache entries (300 - 86400 sec, default = 300).

outbreak-prevention-cache-mpermille.name: outbreak-prevention-cache-mpermille
outbreak-prevention-cache-mpermille.help: Maximum permille of memory FortiGuard Virus Outbreak Prevention cache can use (1 - 150 permille, default = 1).

outbreak-prevention-license.name: outbreak-prevention-license
outbreak-prevention-license.help: Interval of time between license checks for FortiGuard Virus Outbreak Prevention contract.

outbreak-prevention-expiration.name: outbreak-prevention-expiration
outbreak-prevention-expiration.help: Expiration date of FortiGuard Virus Outbreak Prevention contract.

outbreak-prevention-timeout.name: outbreak-prevention-timeout
outbreak-prevention-timeout.help: FortiGuard Virus Outbreak Prevention time out (1 - 30 sec, default = 7).

webfilter-force-off.name: webfilter-force-off
webfilter-force-off.help: Enable/disable turning off the FortiGuard web filtering service.

options.name: enable

options.name: disable

webfilter-expiration.name: webfilter-expiration
webfilter-expiration.help: Expiration date of the FortiGuard web filter contract.

webfilter-timeout.name: webfilter-timeout
webfilter-timeout.help: Web filter query time out (1 - 30 sec, default = 15).
